Atrial fibrillation , hypertension , aortic valve disease , family history of coronary artery disease , hypothyroidism , and tobacco use . ASSOCIATED PROCEDURES : Right and left heart catheterization , coronary angiography , and left ventriculogram . HISTORY AND REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : The patient is a 83-year-old woman under the care of Dr. Lenni Be with a diagnosis of rheumatic mitral stenosis . She had a history of increasing dyspnea on exertion and shortness of breath , orthopnea , and paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea . In addition , she noted palpitations but had a negative Holter monitor for tachy arrhythmias . She is currently New York Heart Association functional class 3 . A 2D echocardiogram showed mitral stenosis with a peak gradient of 23 , mean of 15 and a calculated mitral valve area of 0.9 cm. squared . Her echo score was 10 . There was more involvement of the lateral commissure and mild mitral regurgitation . She also had mild aortic insufficiency , moderate tricuspid regurgitation with an estimated right ventricular systolic pressure of 74 . There was evidence of left-to-right shunting consistent with a patent foramen ovale prior to the trans-septal procedure . She is now referred for PMV . Synthroid , Vitamin E , Centrum , Potassium supplement , Lasix , Coumadin , Atenolol , and Ginkgo . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : She is a pleasant lady in no acute distress , blood pressure 130/70 , irregularly irregular pulses of 70 . Jugular venous pressure normal and carotids normal . Chest was clear . Cardiac examination revealed an apical impulse at the fifth left intercostal space at mid clavicular line , right RV impulse was noted at the left sternal border . First sound was increased but variable intensity , the second sound normally split with an increased P2 . There was an opening snap followed by a long 2 out of 6 diastolic apical rumble . There was no edema and there were good femoral pulses bilaterally . SUMMARY : The patient was taken to the Cardiac Catheterization Laboratory where she was found to have a valve area of 0.6 cm. squared with a mean gradient of 20 . She underwent successful PMV with a valve area increasing to 1.2 cm. squared and a gradient being reduced to 12 . She did well overnight with no chest pain or shortness of breath . She had a transthoracic echocardiogram performed prior to discharge , the results of which are pending at the time of this dictation . The procedure was deemed to be successful and the patient was ultimately discharged on Coumadin , Plendil , Synthroid , Vitamin E , multivitamin , Ginkgo , Lasix , Potassium supplementation and Atenolol . FOLLOW UP : She will follow up with her primary care physician , Dr. Lupevickette Ca and her Cardiologist , Dr. Lenni Be . DWAINCO L.
